gaia::graphics::Paint Class Reference

The Paint class holds the style and color information about how to draw geometries, text and bitmaps. More...

#include <Paint.h>

[legend]

Friends

class text::TextPaint

Detailed Description

The Paint class holds the style and color information about how to draw geometries, text and bitmaps. 

//Example: draw a blue rect and text(with size 10 and NORMAL font) on canvas
    Paint paint;
    Rect rect(0,0,100,100);
    paint.setTypeface(Typeface::defaultFromStyle(Typeface::NORMAL));
    paint.setTextSize(10);
    paint.setColor(Color::BLUE);
    paint.setStyle(Paint::STYLE_FILL);
//draw text
    canvas->drawText("Typeface Test!!- NORMAL, size 10", 50, 50, paint);
//draw rect
    canvas->drawRect(rect, paint);

Definition at line 51 of file Paint.h.

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
ANTI_ALIAS_FLAG 

bit mask for the flag enabling antialiasing

bit mask for the flag enabling bitmap filtering

DITHER_FLAG 

bit mask for the flag enabling dithering

UNDERLINE_TEXT_FLAG 

bit mask for the flag enabling underline text

STRIKE_THRU_TEXT_FLAG 

bit mask for the flag enabling strike-thru text

FAKE_BOLD_TEXT_FLAG 

bit mask for the flag enabling fake-bold text

LINEAR_TEXT_FLAG 

bit mask for the flag enabling linear-text (no caching)

SUBPIXEL_TEXT_FLAG 

bit mask for the flag enabling subpixel-text

DEV_KERN_TEXT_FLAG 

bit mask for the flag enabling device kerning for text

Definition at line 136 of file Paint.h.

enum gaia::graphics::Paint::Align

Align specifies how drawText aligns its text relative to the [x,y] coordinates.

The default is ALIGN_LEFT.

Enumerator:
ALIGN_LEFT 

The text is drawn to the right of the x,y origin.

ALIGN_CENTER 

The text is drawn centered horizontally on the x,y origin.

ALIGN_RIGHT 

The text is drawn to the left of the x,y origin.

Definition at line 121 of file Paint.h.

enum gaia::graphics::Paint::Cap

The Cap specifies the treatment for the beginning and ending of stroked lines and paths.

The default is CAP_BUTT.

Enumerator:
CAP_BUTT 

The stroke ends with the path, and does not project beyond it.

CAP_ROUND 

The stroke projects out as a semicircle, with the center at the end of the path.

CAP_SQUARE 

The stroke projects out as a square, with the center at the end of the path.

Definition at line 81 of file Paint.h.

enum gaia::graphics::Paint::Join

The Join specifies the treatment where lines and curve segments join on a stroked path.

The default is JOIN_MITER.

Enumerator:
JOIN_MITER 

The outer edges of a join meet at a sharp angle.

JOIN_ROUND 

The outer edges of a join meet in a circular arc.

JOIN_BEVEL 

The outer edges of a join meet with a straight line.

Definition at line 102 of file Paint.h.

enum gaia::graphics::Paint::Style

The Style specifies if the primitive being drawn is filled, stroked, or both (in the same color).

The default is STYLE_FILL.

Enumerator:
STYLE_FILL 

Geometry and text drawn with this style will be filled, ignoring all stroke-related settings in the paint.

STYLE_STROKE 

Geometry and text drawn with this style will be stroked, respecting the stroke-related fields on the paint.

STYLE_FILL_AND_STROKE 

Geometry and text drawn with this style will be both filled and stroked at the same time, respecting the stroke-related fields on the paint.

Definition at line 58 of file Paint.h.

size_t gaia::graphics::Paint::breakText ( const base::Array< char16_t > &  text,
size_t  index,
size_t  count,
float  maxWidth,
base::Array< float > *  measuredWidth 
)

Measure the text, stopping early if the measured width exceeds maxWidth.

Return the number of chars that were measured, and return in it the actual width measured.

Parameters:
textThe text to measure
indexThe offset into text to begin measuring at
countThe number of maximum number of entries to measure. If count is negative, then the characters before index are measured in reverse order. This allows for measuring the end of string.
maxWidthThe maximum width to accumulate.
measuredWidthReturns the actual width measured.
Returns:
The number of chars that were measured. Will always be <= abs(count).
size_t gaia::graphics::Paint::breakText ( const base::CharSequence &  text,
size_t  start,
size_t  end,
bool  measureForwards,
float  maxWidth,
base::Array< float > *  measuredWidth 
)

Measure the text, stopping early if the measured width exceeds maxWidth.

Return the number of chars that were measured, and return in it the actual width measured.

Parameters:
textThe text to measure
startThe offset into text to begin measuring at
endThe end of the text slice to measure.
measureForwardsIf true, measure forwards, starting at start. Otherwise, measure backwards, starting with end.
maxWidthThe maximum width to accumulate.
measuredWidthReturns the actual width measured.
Returns:
The number of chars that were measured. Will always be <= abs(end - start).
size_t gaia::graphics::Paint::breakText ( const gaia::base::String &  text,
bool  measureForwards,
float  maxWidth,
base::Array< float > *  measuredWidth 
)

Measure the text, stopping early if the measured width exceeds maxWidth.

Return the number of chars that were measured, and return in it the actual width measured.

Parameters:
textThe text to measure
measureForwardsIf true, measure forwards, starting with the first character in the string. Otherwise, measure backwards, starting with the last character in the string.
maxWidthThe maximum width to accumulate.
measuredWidthReturns the actual width measured.
Returns:
The number of chars that were measured. Will always be <= abs(count).

uint32_t gaia::graphics::Paint::getAlpha ( ) const

Helper to getColor() that just returns the color's alpha value.

This is the same as calling getColor() >>> 24. It always returns a value between 0 (completely transparent) and 255 (completely opaque).

Returns:
the alpha component of the paint's color.
uint32_t gaia::graphics::Paint::getColor ( ) const

Return the paint's color.

Note that the color is a 32bit value containing alpha as well as r,g,b. This 32bit value is not premultiplied, meaning that its alpha can be any value, regardless of the values of r,g,b. See the Color class for more details.

Returns:
the paint's color (and alpha).
ColorFilter* gaia::graphics::Paint::getColorFilter ( ) const

Get the paint's colorfilter (maybe be NULL).

Returns:
the paint's colorfilter (maybe be NULL)
bool gaia::graphics::Paint::getFillPath ( const Path &  src,
Path *  dst 
) const

Applies any/all effects (patheffect, stroking) to src, returning the result in dst.

The result is that drawing src with this paint will be the same as drawing dst with a default paint (at least from the geometric perspective).

Parameters:
srcinput path
dstoutput path (may be the same as src)
Returns:
true if the path should be filled, or false if it should be drawn with a hairline (width == 0)
uint32_t gaia::graphics::Paint::getFlags ( ) const

Return the paint's flags.

Use the Flag enum to test flag values.

Returns:
the paint's flags (see enums ending in _Flag for bit masks)
float gaia::graphics::Paint::getFontMetrics ( const FontMetrics *  metrics) const

Return the font's recommended interline spacing, given the Paint's settings for typeface, textSize, etc.

If metrics is not NULL, return the fontmetric values in it.

Parameters:
metricsIf this object is not NULL, its fields are filled with the appropriate values given the paint's text attributes.
Returns:
the font's recommended interline spacing.
FontMetrics gaia::graphics::Paint::getFontMetrics ( ) const

Allocates a new FontMetrics object, and then calls getFontMetrics(fm) with it, returning the object.

int32_t gaia::graphics::Paint::getFontMetricsInt ( const FontMetricsInt *  fmi) const

Return the font's interline spacing, given the Paint's settings for typeface, textSize, etc.

If metrics is not NULL, return the fontmetric values in it. Note: all values have been converted to integers from floats, in such a way has to make the answers useful for both spacing and clipping. If you want more control over the rounding, call getFontMetrics().ColorFilter

Returns:
the font's interline spacing.
FontMetricsInt gaia::graphics::Paint::getFontMetricsInt ( ) const

Return FontMetricsInt.

float gaia::graphics::Paint::getStrokeWidth ( ) const

Return the width for stroking.

A value of 0 strokes in hairline mode. Hairlines always draws a single pixel independent of the canvas's matrix.

Returns:
the paint's stroke width, used whenever the paint's style is Stroke or StrokeAndFill.
Style gaia::graphics::Paint::getStyle ( ) const

Return the paint's style, used for controlling how primitives' geometries are interpreted (except for drawBitmap, which always assumes FILL_STYLE).

Returns:
the paint's style setting (Fill, Stroke, StrokeAndFill)
Align gaia::graphics::Paint::getTextAlign ( ) const

Return the paint's Align value for drawing text.

This controls how the text is positioned relative to its origin. LEFT align means that all of the text will be drawn to the right of its origin (i.e. the origin specifieds the LEFT edge of the text) and so on.

Returns:
the paint's Align value for drawing text.

size_t  end,
Rect *  bounds

end1 past the last char in the string measure

bool gaia::graphics::Paint::isAntiAlias ( ) const

Helper for getFlags(), returning true if ANTI_ALIAS_FLAG bit is set AntiAliasing smooths out the edges of what is being drawn, but is has no impact on the interior of the shape.

See setFilterBitmap() to affect how colors are treated.

Returns:
true if the antialias bit is set in the paint's flags.
bool gaia::graphics::Paint::isDither ( ) const

Helper for getFlags(), returning true if DITHER_FLAG bit is set Dithering affects how colors that are higher precision than the device are down-sampled.

No dithering is generally faster, but higher precision colors are just truncated down (e.g. 8888 -> 565). Dithering tries to distribute the error inherent in this process, to reduce the visual artifacts.

Returns:
true if the dithering bit is set in the paint's flags.
bool gaia::graphics::Paint::isFakeBoldText ( ) const

Helper for getFlags(), returning true if FAKE_BOLD_TEXT_FLAG bit is set.

Returns:
true if the fakeBoldText bit is set in the paint's flags.
bool gaia::graphics::Paint::isFilterBitmap ( ) const

Whether or not the bitmap filter is activated.

Filtering affects the sampling of bitmaps when they are transformed. Filtering does not affect how the colors in the bitmap are converted into device pixels. That is dependent on dithering and xfermodes.

See also:
setFilterBitmap(bool)

Helper for getFlags(), returning true if LINEAR_TEXT_FLAG bit is set.

Returns:
true if the lineartext bit is set in the paint's flags

The assignment operator.

void gaia::graphics::Paint::reset ( )

Restores the paint to its default settings.

void gaia::graphics::Paint::set ( const Paint &  src)

Copy the fields from src into this paint.

This is equivalent to calling get() on all of the src fields, and calling the corresponding set() methods on this.

void gaia::graphics::Paint::setAlpha ( uint_t  a)

Helper to setColor(), that only assigns the color's alpha value, leaving its r,g,b values unchanged.

Results are undefined if the alpha value is outside of the range [0..255]

Parameters:
aset the alpha component [0..255] of the paint's color.
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setAntiAlias ( bool  aa)

Helper for setFlags(), setting or clearing the ANTI_ALIAS_FLAG bit AntiAliasing smooths out the edges of what is being drawn, but is has no impact on the interior of the shape.

See setFilterBitmap() to affect how colors are treated.

Parameters:
aatrue to set the antialias bit in the flags, false to clear it
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setARGB ( uint_t  a,
uint_t  r,
uint_t  g,
uint_t  b 
)

Helper to setColor(), that takes a,r,g,b and constructs the color int.

Parameters:
aThe new alpha component (0..255) of the paint's color.
rThe new red component (0..255) of the paint's color.
gThe new green component (0..255) of the paint's color.
bThe new blue component (0..255) of the paint's color.
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setColor ( uint32_t  color)

Set the paint's color.

Note that the color is an int containing alpha as well as r,g,b. This 32bit value is not premultiplied, meaning that its alpha can be any value, regardless of the values of r,g,b. See the Color class for more details.

Parameters:
colorThe new color (including alpha) to set in the paint.

Set or clear the paint's colorfilter, returning the parameter.

Parameters:
filterMay be NULL. The new filter to be installed in the paint
Returns:
filter
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setDither ( bool  dither)

Helper for setFlags(), setting or clearing the DITHER_FLAG bit Dithering affects how colors that are higher precision than the device are down-sampled.

No dithering is generally faster, but higher precision colors are just truncated down (e.g. 8888 -> 565). Dithering tries to distribute the error inherent in this process, to reduce the visual artifacts.

Parameters:
dithertrue to set the dithering bit in flags, false to clear it

Parameters:
fakeBoldTexttrue to set the fakeBoldText bit in the paint's flags, false to clear it.
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setFilterBitmap ( bool  filter)

Helper for setFlags(), setting or clearing the FILTER_BITMAP_FLAG bit.

Filtering affects the sampling of bitmaps when they are transformed. Filtering does not affect how the colors in the bitmap are converted into device pixels. That is dependent on dithering and xfermodes.

Parameters:
filtertrue to set the FILTER_BITMAP_FLAG bit in the paint's flags, false to clear it.

void gaia::graphics::Paint::setShadowLayer ( float  radius,
float  dx,
float  dy,
uint32_t  color 
)

Temporary API to expose layer drawing.

This draws a shadow layer below the main layer, with the specified offset and color, and blur radius. If radius is 0, then the shadow layer is removed.

void gaia::graphics::Paint::setStrokeMiter ( float  miter)

Set the paint's stroke miter value.

This is used to control the behavior of miter joins when the joins angle is sharp. This value must be >= 0.

Parameters:
miterset the miter limit on the paint, used whenever the paint's style is Stroke or StrokeAndFill.
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setStrokeWidth ( float  width)

Set the width for stroking.

Pass 0 to stroke in hairline mode. Hairlines always draws a single pixel independent of the canvas's matrix.

Parameters:
widthset the paint's stroke width, used whenever the paint's style is Stroke or StrokeAndFill.
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setStyle ( Style  style)

Set the paint's style, used for controlling how primitives' geometries are interpreted (except for drawBitmap, which always assumes Fill).

Parameters:
styleThe new style to set in the paint

void gaia::graphics::Paint::setTextAlign ( Align  align)

Set the paint's text alignment.

This controls how the text is positioned relative to its origin. LEFT align means that all of the text will be drawn to the right of its origin (i.e. the origin specifieds the LEFT edge of the text) and so on.

Parameters:
alignset the paint's Align value for drawing text.
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setTextScaleX ( float  scaleX)

Set the paint's horizontal scale factor for text.

The default value is 1.0. Values > 1.0 will stretch the text wider. Values < 1.0 will stretch the text narrower.

Parameters:
scaleXset the paint's scale in X for drawing/measuring text.
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setTextSize ( float  textSize)

Set the paint's text size.

This value must be > 0

Parameters:
textSizeset the paint's text size.
void gaia::graphics::Paint::setTextSkewX ( float  skewX)

Set the paint's horizontal skew factor for text.

The default value is 0. For approximating oblique text, use values around -0.25.

Parameters:
skewXset the paint's skew factor in X for drawing text.
